Structure# MarkDimensions

iOS 18.0+iPadOS 18.0+Mac Catalyst 18.0+macOS 15.0+tvOS 18.0+visionOS 2.0+watchOS 11.0+

```
struct MarkDimensions<DataElement>
```

## [Topics](/documentation/charts/markdimensions#topics)

### [Initializers](/documentation/charts/markdimensions#Initializers)

[`init(floatLiteral: Double)`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/init(floatliteral:))Creates a constant width or height from a floating point value.[`init(integerLiteral: Int)`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/init(integerliteral:))Creates a constant width or height from an integer.### [Type Properties](/documentation/charts/markdimensions#Type-Properties)

[`static var automatic: MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/automatic)A dimension that determines its value automatically.### [Type Methods](/documentation/charts/markdimensions#Type-Methods)

[`static func fixed(CGFloat) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/fixed(_:)-14cur)A constant dimension.[`static func fixed(KeyPath<DataElement, CGFloat>) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/fixed(_:)-7k7pv)A constant dimension.[`static func inset(KeyPath<DataElement, CGFloat>) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/inset(_:)-309e3)A dimension that’s the step size minus the specified inset value on each side.[`static func inset(CGFloat) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/inset(_:)-5nddx)A dimension that’s the step size minus the specified inset value on each side.[`static func ratio(CGFloat) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/ratio(_:)-8ufgm)A dimension that’s proportional to the scale step size, using the specified ratio.[`static func ratio(KeyPath<DataElement, CGFloat>) -> MarkDimensions<DataElement>`](/documentation/charts/markdimensions/ratio(_:)-r23h)A dimension that’s proportional to the scale step size, using the specified ratio.## [Relationships](/documentation/charts/markdimensions#relationships)
